section.title: Definition
section.para: The kickstart element specifies either the PATH to a kickstart file, or the text of a file to be created. The resulting file is named ks.cfg and included in the distribution's os folder, e.g. http://server.company.com/distributions/samba-server-5-i386/os/ks.cfg. It is also included in the and images, and in all .
For more information on creating and using kickstart files, see the SystemStudio User Manual.
section.note: It is not necessary to specify a '%packages' section in the kickstart file. SystemStudio automatically configures the installer to install all packages in the distribution repository. If a '%packages' section is provided, it is ignored.

listitem.para: Accepts either "file" or "text". When content is "file", the element's text value is treated as a PATH to a file, whereas when it is "text", the element's text value is interpreted as the raw text to use for creating a file. The default value is "file".

informalexample.programlisting: <kickstart content="text"> install lang en_US network bootproto=dhcp clearpart --all autopart bootloader --location=mbr timezone America/Vancouver auth --enablemd5 --enableshadow --enablecache rootpw secret selinux --enforcing reboot </kickstart>
